title: No Defense = Poor Gameplay
body:
I don't feel like I'm playing a game of strategy I feel like I'm playing slap jack where the fastest hardest hitting person wins. 

This gameplay without proper defense options really makes me feel like I'm just running it down.  It isn't that enjoyable just running at the enemy and praying that you have more damage, or that they miss a skill. It is actually surprising that the community isn't even more toxic than it is considering how we all play like we are suicidal maniacs (or completely afk) in game.

My proposal is simple, make tanks durable by making durability items better. When we have champs like tank ekko come back if they are too tanky just mow down their per level damages and give them better ad/ap scaling so they have to build damage to deal damage.

Win trades? what the fuck am i supposed to be playing to win trades vs a draven? Jax?
What are you playing ?

On adc jhin, corki and sometimes lucian. Jhin is, or even better, used to be a adc that was actually a good match for draven but right now is useless. Corki good as always but draven still does insane damage early on and a good draven will never lose to lucian. But no matter, there is no adc that can counter him.

You can definitely play Lucian into Draven and it becomes a skill matchup. Jhins early game took a hit as he got too much early strength from HOB so he can’t win early trades and corki is not a very good adc  in my opinion and is still a poke champ. 

The trick to Draven is not taking long early game trades as he has the upper hand in those but quick bursty trades with cc that can cause him to loose his axes

Making him lose the axes hasn't any effect anyways, he does not have any mana cost whatsoever so him missing him means nothing and its cd is also very low. Draven mains will also be comfortable with 2 axes so again, making him miss 1 is nothing.
From my experience as playing a velkoz support those are the tactics that I use to win trades and they ARE successful

Its not about wanting to do damage, its about wanting to be beefy enough that I don't die to the first person that sneezes at me.

Its not that I don't just feel im not playing strategy anymore, I feel actually unhealthy playstyles like inting are now actually encouraged.
They actually promote an unhealthy playstyle and are surprised that the communitys toxicity is growing fast.

League isn't for experienced gamers anymore, its for entry level gaming.
Well they have dumbed the down game imo with high damage and the changes they made to speed games up.

Back in the day, when one teammate ran around alone trying to oneshot people instead of getting objectives, that could easily cost the game. Nowadays I feel like I'm trolling if I DON'T do that, because odds are someone else is running around casually killing everything in the time it takes to set up anything strategic.

I mean not to say it’s a good idea( I did win the game though)... I got auto filled into jungle and was like fuck it I’ll pick Morde anyways. Enemy akali same gold was doing 1/3 of my hp per hit. Q R R was me dead. Just felt like ass to play. 

I wish I could be cool like talon and akali and have one less damage ability but still have the same damage as if I had 4... 

Riot just doesn’t power budget utility anymore. Which is why we just go done having akali, Irelia, Asttrox all gutted.

It’s because only certain classes get to have all this damage, then riot tacked on tank stats to all their items for no actual reason. 

Mages average 150 mr and 150 armor and 3000+hp without going crazy far out of their builds. 

Bruisers manage 3k hp 400 ad and 200+ in their defensive stats. 

Assassins manage 500+ad 2500 hp and about 125 in each resistance. 

What do tanks get? 300 in each resistance. 3k hp and that’s about it. 

Then account for the stupid amounts of %pen and %shred and %hp damage and it’s no wonder damage is the only thing viable.
It wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't for all of the penetration and true damage. Sadly it just seems like riot doesn't actually care about making this game strategic.

Just youtube Talon's old video from 7 years ago of the video spotlight series and you'll see how ridiculous damage has gotten in this game by comparison.

An Ahri is landing a charm and with electrocute doing 60%+ of your health in a single trade as of the current patch. That kind of burst was simply not happening in earlier seasons.

Lanes are now decided by a single bad trade or maybe two and there's no getting back after those unless your jungler is camping the lane to get you back in.

hm...
since season 6 about every 1-3 days we get a post like this with several upvotes ALL THE TIME
yet rito ignores us.
also rito be like: i dont get why our community is so angry atr us :/

"When we have champs like tank ekko come back"

Good Base Damage, Low Ratios = Champions that are able to deal damage even while going tank

Low Base Damage, Good Ratios = Champions that are inclined to build damage items

I never understood how Riot managed to fuck these things up in the first place tbh

Literally if you want champions to be inclined to build damage, have them scale well only with offensive items (By this I mean don't make it so that their base damage can outdamage whatever the ratio can do if they decide to go tank over damage)

If you want champions to build tanky, make it so damage items aren't worth it on them.

It isn't rocket science and it never was.
Exactly. Balance jokes aside that’s why things like Yasuo getting double crit is a balance issue. Gives him absurdly good damage while leaving the rest of his item slots open.

I just want a game where fights either naturally last longer or we have a choice to build tank items (on non tanks) to reasonably live longer like in season 4-5.  Longer fights are just more fun and move the emphasis from vision/catching out to playing well over a longer period of time during team fights- repositioning, chasing, using multiple skill rotations, etc.

I really, really miss playing offtank {{champion:432}} in these long fights back in the day. Stun, drop a health pack near ADC, Magical Journey behind the enemy flank to setup the next stun, hold Tempered Fate for a great catch or escape, Stun, Journey away, etc. Nowadays I can carry a game MUCH harder with Bard due to his early damage, but I actually prefer the more beefy/utilitarian playstyle that is durable enough to setup those flanking plays I just can't do any more since I die if an ADC/Mage/Assassin/Fighter so much as looks at me. Raw burst damage is boring, one dimensional, and ultimately selfish.

not true. People believe that building old Thornmail vs any autoattack champion was strategy, but boi it was not.

League NEVER was highly strategic game, and most of the league strategy is now present more than in seasons 1-3. Strategy in league is stuff like wave manipulation, rotations, objective setup, or vision placement. Counterbuilding and counterplay aren't as strategic as people make them to be. Especially counterbuilding, which is as strategic as rock paper scissors
